title: Remove streams from channels
description:
Implement ability to remove streams from channels:
- When viewing a channel's assigned streams, show remove button (X or minus icon)
- Confirmation before removal (optional, could be a setting)
- Call API to remove stream from channel
- Optimistic UI update with rollback on error
- Success/error toast notifications
- Alternative: drag stream out of channel to 'unassign' area

title: Frontend: Two-pane layout with channels (left) and streams (right)
description:
Create the main UI layout:
- Left pane: Channels list
  - Display channel name, number, logo
  - Show count of assigned streams per channel
  - Clicking a channel shows its assigned streams (expandable or inline)
  - Scrollable list with virtualization for performance
- Right pane: Streams list  
  - Display stream name, logo, provider info
  - Visual indicator if stream is already assigned to selected channel
  - Scrollable list with virtualization for performance
- Responsive layout that works on various screen sizes
- Loading states and error handling

title: Backend API endpoints for frontend consumption
description:
Create FastAPI endpoints that proxy/aggregate Dispatcharr data:
- GET /api/channels - list channels with filtering support
- GET /api/channels/{id}/streams - get streams assigned to a channel
- GET /api/streams - list all streams with filtering support
- GET /api/channel-groups - list channel groups (for filter dropdowns)
- GET /api/stream-groups - list stream groups (for filter dropdowns)
- GET /api/providers - list M3U accounts/providers (for filter dropdowns)
- POST /api/channels/{id}/add-stream - add stream to channel
- POST /api/channels/{id}/remove-stream - remove stream from channel
- Query params for filtering: channel_group, m3u_account, search/name

title: Debug channel groups not all displaying
description: Some channel groups like 'National Sports Networks' and 'Local Channels' are not showing in the UI. Need to investigate why groups are missing.

title: Filter out auto-created channel groups from display
Resizable split pane with draggable divider for channels/streams
Docker compose configuration for production deployment
description: Simplified docker-compose.yml for production deployment. Single container runs on port 6100, uses a named volume (ecm-config) for persistent settings storage, and includes host.docker.internal mapping for accessing Dispatcharr on the host machine.

title: Inline channel detail: show streams underneath channel when clicked
description: Replace the separate ChannelDetail pane with inline expansion. When a channel is clicked, its assigned streams should appear directly underneath the channel item in the channels list, similar to an accordion pattern. This provides a more compact and intuitive UI.

title: Bulk selection and operations
description:
Multi-select support for bulk operations:

Selection mechanics:
- Click to select single item
- Ctrl+Click to toggle additional items
- Shift+Click to select range
- Ctrl+A to select all (in focused pane)
- Click elsewhere to deselect all
- Visual selection indicator (checkbox or highlight)

Bulk operations for streams:
- Add multiple selected streams to a channel (drag group or button)
- Remove multiple streams from a channel

Bulk operations for channels:
- Delete multiple channels
- Assign multiple channels to a group
- Renumber selected channels sequentially

UI:
- Selection count indicator
- Bulk action toolbar/context menu when items selected
- Confirmation dialogs for destructive operations

title: Channel groups as tree with drag-and-drop channel assignment
description:
Channel groups displayed as a tree structure in the left pane:

Structure:
- Channel groups are collapsible tree nodes
- Channels are leaf nodes nested under their group
- Ungrouped channels shown at root level or in 'Uncategorized' group

Drag-and-drop operations:
- Drag channel into a group to assign it
- Drag channel out of group (to root or another group) to reassign
- Drag channel between groups to move it
- API call to update channel's channel_group_id on drop

Group management (TBD - UI style pending):
- Create new channel groups
- Rename groups
- Delete groups (move channels to ungrouped or another group)
- Reorder groups

Visual:
- Expand/collapse icons for groups
- Channel count badge per group
- Indentation for hierarchy
- Drag handles or full-row draggable

Note: Detailed UI styling to be determined later

title: Stream priority reordering within channels
description:
Allow reordering streams within a channel to set priority:
- When viewing a channel's assigned streams, allow drag-and-drop reorder
- First stream = highest priority (used for playback)
- Visual drag handles for stream items
- API call to update channel's streams array order
- Optimistic UI with rollback on error
- Visual indication of priority order (numbers or position)

title: Show provider name on inline channel streams
description: Display the provider/M3U account name for each stream shown in the inline channel detail view, so users can identify which provider each stream comes from.

title: Drag-and-drop: Add streams to channels
description:
Implement drag-and-drop functionality to add streams to channels:
- Streams in right pane are draggable
- Channels in left pane are drop targets
- Visual feedback during drag (highlight valid drop targets)
- On drop: call API to add stream to channel
- Optimistic UI update with rollback on error
- Success/error toast notifications
- Prevent duplicate stream assignment (visual indicator + validation)

Tech: Use react-dnd or @dnd-kit/core for drag-and-drop implementation

title: Frontend: Filtering for channels and streams
description:
Add filtering capabilities to both panes:

Channels pane filters:
- Channel group dropdown (populated from API)
- Name search (interactive text input with debounce)

Streams pane filters:
- Stream/channel group dropdown
- Provider/M3U account dropdown (populated from API)
- Name search (interactive text input with debounce)

Implementation:
- Filter controls at top of each pane
- Filters applied client-side for responsiveness, with option to query server
- Clear/reset filters button
- Filter state preserved during session
- URL query params for shareable filter states (optional)

title: Group streams by source and sort alphabetically within groups
Channel reordering with automatic renumbering
description:
Drag-and-drop reordering of channels with smart renumbering:
- Channels can be dragged to reorder in the list
- When a channel is inserted between two others, renumber affected channels
- Example: channels 1,2,3 - moving 3 between 1 and 2 results in: 1,3→2,2→3
- Use the /api/channels/channels/assign/ bulk endpoint for efficient renumbering
- Visual drag handle or entire row draggable
- Optimistic UI update with rollback on error
- Consider decimal numbers for insertion without full renumber (e.g., 1.5 between 1 and 2) as alternative mode

title: Dispatcharr API client with JWT authentication
description:
Create a Python API client for Dispatcharr:
- JWT token authentication (login, token refresh)
- GET channels list with pagination support
- GET streams list with pagination support  
- GET streams for a specific channel
- PATCH channel to update streams array (add/remove streams)
- Error handling and retry logic
- Environment-based configuration (DISPATCHARR_URL, credentials)

title: Project setup: Docker, FastAPI backend, React frontend scaffolding
description:
Set up the foundational project structure:
- Dockerfile for single container deployment
- FastAPI backend with CORS, static file serving
- React frontend with Vite or Create React App
- docker-compose.yml for development
- Environment variable configuration for Dispatcharr URL and credentials
- Basic health check endpoint

title: Channel number editing in UI
description:
Allow editing channel numbers directly in the UI:
- Display channel number for each channel in the list
- Inline editing (click to edit) or edit modal
- Validation: only allow floats or integers
- API call to update channel number on save
- Handle conflicts (warn if number already in use)
- Visual feedback on save success/failure

title: Sort channel groups by lowest channel number
Settings UI for Dispatcharr connection configuration
description: Add a settings modal UI to configure Dispatcharr connection (URL, username, password) instead of requiring environment variables. Settings are stored in a JSON file (/config/settings.json) and persist across container restarts. Includes test connection button, auto-popup on first load when not configured, and Settings button in header.

title: Channel group filter with multi-select checkboxes, hide unused groups
